value:
Seeing my brother grow into his own,
surrounded by his friends, fills me
with pride. Please, treat him well.

Gra was Altea's trusted neighbor and
ally, until King Jiol betrayed us. Marth
did what he had to do to survive.

Marth is the hope, and the future, of
Altea—for there is now no other in
the world who can wield Falchion.

Setting sun shining through the forest
canopy... Birdsong in rhythm with the
streams... This world is beautiful.

The only silver lining in the fall of
Altea Castle was that Malledus and
Jagen secured my brother's escape.

May all friendship be as everlasting
as the one between you
and $Nf...

Even as we revere what was built by
our forebears, let us recognize that it
is today's hearts that shape tomorrow.

Heroes do not simply appear out of
nowhere. It was the refusal to yield
to despair that gave rise to Anri.

Marth...you and I are all that remains
of House Altea's blood. It falls to us
to fulfill our family's duty.

I still recall Marth being so frustrated
that he could not match Merric in his
studies. Ah, they grow up so fast...

I am Elice, princess of Altea—but I
assume you are more familiar with
the name of my brother, Marth.

Do you ever find yourself exhausted
by the sheer number of issues at
hand, $Nu?$k$pI am sometimes overwhelmed when I
consider all the brave souls who gave
their lives to protect Altea.$k$pI had intended to meet the same fate
as my castle, then. Instead, I became
a hostage of Grust, Gra, and Dolhr.$k$pIronically, it was Gharnef who saved
me. He wished me to wield the staff
of Aum, found in the Resurrectory.$k$pI still do not understand what he
hopes to achieve, but I pray that
Marth will put a stop to his plans.
As princess...
Reconsider your actions!
I will not let you through!
It is my duty.
Oh, Marth...
Are you well?
You mustn't give up!
I am Elice, the princess of Altea.
Merric, when did you become so reliable?
Marth is the hope, and the future, of Altea.
Oh Marth... Stay safe, and live on...
You are much like my brother — a light that leads the way.
Yes?
What shall we do?
Let us go.
